newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: No plans yet to postpone Smart IPO - First Pacific.
newsitem.headline: No plans yet to postpone Smart IPO - First Pacific.

text.p: Shareholders of Smart Communications Inc have yet to decide whether to postpone the initial public offering of the cellular phone compoany, First Pacific Co Ltd managing director Manuel Pangilinan said on Tuesday.
"We don't know yet. We're watching the market very carefully," Pangilinan told Reuters when asked to confirm market talk that the Smart IPO would be postponed due to poor market condition.
The Philippine stock market has been on a steep decline, shedding nearly 28 percent since its all-time peak of 3,477.60 points in February.
Smart underwriters have scheduled the IPO some time between July and September.
"Quite likely, I would say it's going to be the latter date than the earlier date," he said.
Pangilinan said the underwriters have to review the offering price range if the IPO were to be launched in September to take into consideration 1998 earnings.
First Pacific currently owns 35 percent of Smart, while its flagship company in the Philippines, Metro Pacific Corp, owns another 35 percent.
